brief_summary.textblock:
This study seeks to compare the differences in effectiveness among individual patients
      treated at for hypertension with bedtime administration of amlodipine versus lisinopril.
      There will be an analysis of whether one medication was more effective than another and
      whether specific patient factors could predict who responded better to which one.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bedtime Administration of Amlodipine Versus Lisinopril

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 40 to 80

          -  Newly diagnosed hypertension based on 24 hour ambulatory blood pressure monitor
             criteria.

          -  Minimum Asleep SBP mean of ≥ 120mmHg for inclusion.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current antihypertensive medication use

          -  Baseline GFR < 45

          -  Preexisting macroproteinuria

          -  Chronic congestive heart failure

          -  History of CVA

          -  Diabetes Mellitus

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Night-shift work

          -  Other preexisting contraindication to amlodipine or lisinopril

intervention.description: crossover comparison of amlodipine vs lisinopril

clinical_study.keyword: managed with bedtime administration of lisinopril versus amlodipine
clinical_study.official_title: Bedtime Administration of Amlodipine Versus Lisinopril: a Randomized Trial

primary_outcome.measure: Change in mean sleep-time systolic blood pressure after addition of a bedtime dose of amlodipine versus lisinopril

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mean sleep-time diastolic, awake systolic and diastolic blood pressures, including comparison of % achieving target BP
Impact of individual medications on sleep-time blood pressure drop (dipping status)
Association of baseline renin levels to sleep-time blood pressure drop
Association of baseline renin levels with response to amlodipine versus lisinopril
Association of baseline dipping status with response to amlodipine versus lisinopril
Association of age and response to amlodipine versus lisinopril

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
